entries.meaning: (beekeeping, archaic) A small stand on which a beehive is placed.
(beekeeping) A spacer put between or over or under hive parts to make more space.

verbs.description: eke (third-person singular simple present ekes, present participle eking or ekeing, simple past and past participle eked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) Chiefly in the form eke out: to add to, to augment; to increase; to lengthen.

examples: A vinegary face has Mrs Miff, and a mortified bonnet, and eke a thirsty soul for sixpences and shillings.
